title: Pork rissoles in creamy mushroom sauce
ingredients:
500g pork or chicken mince
1 egg
1 cup breadcrumbs (I toasted four slices bread and blitzed them)
1 pkt cream mushroom cup of soup.
1 clove garlic crushed (add to bread crumbs and blitz together)
Salt and pepper
Olive oil
Sauce
1 cup chicken stock
4-5 finely sliced mushrooms
1/2 finely sliced onion
1 pkt of mushroom soup
1 cup thickened cream
method: Combine mince, bread crumbs, egg, seasonings and packet of soup  into large bowl.
Mix together and form into rissoles.
I got twelve rissoles of about 50g each.
In a large fry pan cook rissoles on both sides until cooked through.
In same pan add mushrooms and onion cook for about four minutes.
Add 1 cup stock, sprinkle over cup of soup powder, stir to combine and bring to the boil.
Add 1 cup cream lower heat, stir until sauces thickens.
Arrange the rissoles onto a serving plate and pour over creamy sauce.
Serve with your favourite mash (potato, sweet potato, cauliflower/parsnip) and winter greens.
testimonials: If the French onion soup variety is more your style, omit the mushrooms and pork and use chicken and packet of French Onion soup. It could also easily be modified to a GF version with suitable bread/rice crumbs and GF soup packet. Bon Apetit, Cheers, Pauline
